instructions: Mix all the ingredients together until a soft and non-sticky dough forms, then let it rest for half an hour.
Shape the dough into circles with a hole in the middle. Fry them in hot deep oil until golden brown, then remove and place on paper towels. Dip in syrup.
notes: Yoyo is a traditional Tunisian-Djerban Jewish treat, often enjoyed during festive occasions. The syrup adds a delightful sweetness that complements the fried dough.
